results.title: Divorce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
Examines the impact of divorce on both children and adults. Uses the case study of a fictional family to show the problems, adjustments, and critical issues involved when couples decide to get a divorce.

results.title: Division of human tumor cells = Teilung von menschlichen tumorzellen
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and H. Lettre
results.brief_description: The film shows human tumour cells which have been removed from a patient with carcinoma of the stomach. The cells are contained in the ascitic fluid drawn off from the patient and are observed in this fluid for several hours after removal. A phase-contracts microscope is used with a magnification of 900 times. The conditions for the continued growth and division of the cells are not the most favourable and, in general, only preparations for divisions are observed. However, a normal cell division has been recorded and also a case of tetra-polar division. Silent, with captions in German.

results.title: Division (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The partitive and measure aspects of division are introduced when a group of children discuss two sharing situations and begin to make a wall chart. The program changes direction near the end to show children applying the four operations they have considered, to find as many ways of writing “6” as they can discover.

results.title: Diving: no place for cowards
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, ONF | NFB and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: The top of a ten-meter diving tower is no place for cowards, according to Jim Lambie, the vociferous coach of two of Canada’s top female divers, Janet Nutter and Linda Cuthbert. In this film we see what goes into making a champion performer and the complete faith and loyalty the athletes have towards Lambie despite his brusque manner. A highlight of the film is the close diving competition at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton.

results.title: Diving fundamentals
results.creator_credit: New Official Films and Norman L. Sper
results.brief_description: Opens with a brief history of the sport of diving followed by a demonstration and explanation of the fundamental techniques of diving including the correct way of take-off and lift, entry into the water, proper arm action and body positioning. Commentary by Ken Carpenter. Instruction by Fred Cady.

results.title: Diving
results.brief_description: A very detailed instructional film, explaining the fundamentals of diving, and demonstrating all the most popular championship dives with the aid of slow and stop-motion photography.

results.title: Divine horsemen: the living gods of Haiti
results.brief_description: In September 1947 documentary, experimental and avant-garde filmmaker Maya Deren disembarked in Haiti for a eight month stay. Over the subsequent years (1947-54) Deren intimately and artfully documented the rituals and culture of the people there, providing a fascinating ethnographic study of Voudoun dances and rituals. This work provides insight into the world of Voudou, the ‘Divine Horsemen’ being the being the Gods of Voodoo. The meaning of the dance, songs, drawings and rituals are explained in voiceover, providing an explanation of how the people respond and pay tribute to the different Gods. This is a fascinating and stunning insight into a culture that is frequently misunderstood in the West and often maligned in mainstream cinema. Deren published a monograph on her studies but never edited the footage which was completed by Teiji Ito and Cherel Ito after her death.

results.title: Divided we stand
results.creator_credit: Olga Edridge, BBC and Rizu Hamid
results.brief_description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.
results.description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.

results.title: Divided trail: a Native American odyssey
results.brief_description: Uses archival footage and stills to document the beginnings of the American Indian protest movement in Chicago during the 1970s. Three leaders of the movement recount the events which motivated them to bring public attention to the plight of the American Indian, who has left the reservation with promises of employment and a better life only to find unemployment, slums and alcoholism.

results.title: Divided Germany
results.creator_credit: Matthias Walden and Profil Filmproduktion Report
results.brief_description: The division of Germany and events leading up to it. Originally an administrative partition it became a physical division when a zone was cleared, a concrete wall and watch towers erected. The drain on man power caused by the flight of one in six East Germans resulted in almost total cessation of movement to the West. As long as the wall existed, political tensions could not be relieved.
